author: Aloysius Xavier Lopez
text:
Five years since they were added to the Corporation, the eight new zones — Tiruvottiyur, Manali, Madhavaram, Ambattur, Valsaravakkam, Alandur, Perungudi and Sholinganallur — continue to receive step-motherly treatment when it comes to provision of playgrounds and sports facilities.

As many as 228 of the 261 playgrounds that are under the Greater Chennai Corporation are found within the old city limits.

There were proposals a few years ago to develop more playgrounds in the merged areas, but they were not carried through to execution. Non-availability of land is said to be major reason for this.

Tiruvottiyur zone is a case in point. “The Fisheries Department refused to give land. The Corporation does not have any land in Tiruvottiyur,” said a councillor. Residents have been requesting the civic body for sports facilities in WIMCO Nagar and Nettukuppam, but obtaining land continues to be challenge, say officials. Even after the merger, most of the documents pertaining to land earmarked for playgrounds in added areas have not been handed over by the erstwhile local bodies to the Corporation. The civic body has not tried to trace such lands either.

The few playgrounds that are found in the merged areas lack modern facilities that promote fitness and recreation. On this front too, areas within the old city limits are considerably better off.
title: It is hardly a level playing field
